actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to provide that no civil penalty may be assessed with respect to the initial issuance of a citation for any violation of such act.

summary.text: Provides that no civil penalty may be assessed with respect to the initial issuance of a citation for any violation of the Occupational Safety and Health Act. States that if the employer does not correct any such violation within a specified time period, the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare may conduct such inspections and issue such citations necessary to assure the abatement of the violation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to provide that no civil penalty may be assessed with respect to the initial issuance of a citation for any violation of such act.
